attributes.comment:
To Whom it May Concern,

I'm writing in regards to the Proposed Adoption-Related Petitions Increase of
around 66%. My wife and I are in the process of adopting a baby from China. As
you may know, the adoption time went from 6 months to 12+ months over the last
year which has already caused extra stress, disappointment, etc. for many
adopting families. Not only this emotional burden has had to be dealt with, but
also due to the extension of adoptive children several of the documentation and
procedures have expired causing addition expenses to families adopting such
children. To now see such a petition to raise such fees by the Federal Gov. is to
say the least disappointing yet again. We are adopting 1 or 2 children from China
with hopes and dreams to provide them a much better life than they would have in
China by being abandoned. Such petitions will only make it more difficult for
people such as us to live such of a dream due to continue expenses going up from
where they were a few years ago. Adoption is already a very expensive process
and this only steers and lessens the families in the USA that will be able to afford
to do this now and into the future.

Your re-consideration is very much appreciated,

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anonymous
